content.description: If you boulder you should find the starting crimps easily. Pull off the ground and slap tough onto a slopey but good ledge which you'll be mantling onto. No hands rest, but then a very dicey move or two to gain the summit of Lunch Rock from here.
content.protection: No protection, use a toprope if you're worried.
content.location: As you're staring at Lunch Rock "main face", it's the left side not quite around the corner.

content.description: Several variations are possible on the West Face with difficulty in the V0-V1 range. Down climb to the climbers right (South side).
content.location: Located next to Lunch Rock in the shady area between the Main Dome and the Little Dome, where the Echo Canyon Trail meets the Purple and the Green trails.

content.description: Several slab problems run up the face of this boulder, from V0-V2. The climbing gets easier the higher you go.
content.protection: Crash pad for the highball, 2 bolts for a TR anchor if you want to practice.
content.location: This is the large slab face that you see once you enter the trees from the approach trail.

content.description: Really fun powerful moves on absolutely terrible rock, to a high/ dirty top out. Rock quality is very poor
content.location: Looking at lunch rock direct slab go left around the side, slightly over hanging obvious crimps traversing left, to ever worsening rock

content.description: Shady area thats good for bouldering during hot, sunny days.
